title: Bi-Weekly Music Discussion Thread
selftext:
What is r/India listening to? Share and discuss songs, playlists, artists, or anything music-related here!

If you're a musician yourself, please share your work so we can all hear what up-and-coming musicians are doing these days.

Don't just mention stuff, link it! Links that are official and provided by the artists themselves are preferred.

**Music Thread is posted every two weeks on Tuesday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Bi-Weekly+Music+Discussion+Thread&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/06d0xwq1x8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=4195dbb767ebd70a3209ea46a4497062e788c176
comments:
Encanto - Surface Pressure

The song is brilliant and Luisa is best girl

My three recos for the thread:

* [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-Cip1wTysbI](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-Cip1wTysbI)  
Worries by Tom Rosenthal. A little melancholic, but beautiful.
* [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=My6nHaMDLBY](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=My6nHaMDLBY)  
Start Again by Rianne Downey. Simple, upbeat number about making a fresh start.
* [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G7Sk1g2qWH4](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G7Sk1g2qWH4)  
True love by Hovvdy. Dreamy feel to the song, Allmusic calls this genre slowcore.

Dagny - Wearing Nothing -- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hMqLEwk7KAw

Dagny - Love You Like That -- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bnQBqinwlwQ
 
Dagny ft Børns - Fool's Gold -- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qz4wPWf4KJo


Obsessed with Dagny these days.
Coke Studio is going to BD -- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sMwKrxZKUSc

I prob have the weirdest choice

Songs i have streamed the most are

• Someone Like You
• Harlem Shake
• Passionfruit
• Take Care
• That song where Kanye and his friends are in Paris
• Rolling in the deep
Wig Wam - Do Ya Wanna Taste It
african american gentlemen in paris is a vibe

Radiohead. Radiohead. Radiohead

Do checkout the below songs tho!

[https://open.spotify.com/track/10nyNJ6zNy2YVYLrcwLccB?si=91368c79baf146af](https://open.spotify.com/track/10nyNJ6zNy2YVYLrcwLccB?si=91368c79baf146af) \- No Surprises

[https://open.spotify.com/track/10nyNJ6zNy2YVYLrcwLccB?si=91368c79baf146af](https://open.spotify.com/track/10nyNJ6zNy2YVYLrcwLccB?si=91368c79baf146af) \- Let Down

[https://open.spotify.com/track/73CKjW3vsUXRpy3NnX4H7F?si=0e454ff56c95467f](https://open.spotify.com/track/73CKjW3vsUXRpy3NnX4H7F?si=0e454ff56c95467f) \- Fake plastic trees
Radiohead is fucking awesome, No surprises was one of the first songs I learnt on guitar

The Beatles - A day in the life ( probably the greatest song ever written)  
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=usNsCeOV4GM

Layla - Derek and the Dominos ( Eric Clapton), amazing rocker with epic piano coda  
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TngViNw2pOo

Time - Pink floyd ( a song that will make you float)https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JwYX52BP2Sk

Sri Ram Janaki Bethe Hai Mere Seene Mein
https://youtu.be/MxGItnRhsBI

I used to love Rock music a few years ago - Pink Floyd, Led Zeppelin, Rory Gallagher, Zappacosta, The Who, etc but after coming to US my taste changed. I listen a lot of Jai Uttal, MC Yogi, Kirtaniyas, etc.

If I may link my own stuff- I play guitar as a hobby, but I've taken it quite seriously. I upload short clips on insta- usually pretty rough, either solo transcriptions or improvisation. 

https://www.instagram.com/tv/CZpLaV9F5jz/?utm_medium=copy_link

Frank Ocean - Nights: [https://open.spotify.com/track/7eqoqGkKwgOaWNNHx90uEZ?si=a6a65ce256cf4fe8](https://open.spotify.com/track/7eqoqGkKwgOaWNNHx90uEZ?si=a6a65ce256cf4fe8)  
Radiohead - Nude: [https://open.spotify.com/track/35YyxFpE0ZTOoqFx5bADW8?si=36b5a3c2490d4126](https://open.spotify.com/track/35YyxFpE0ZTOoqFx5bADW8?si=36b5a3c2490d4126)  
Black Country, New Road - Basketball Shoes: https://open.spotify.com/track/4ShVovnLIlObG43vwaCRkJ?si=ef2cd4b6dde74ad3
In Rainbows > Kid A >> OK Computer
I feel The bends and Ok Computer are their best albums. But yeah no matter what, Radiohead for life!
well i'll get back to u once i complete their discography.
>it's so nice to meet people who like radiohead. im so happy i might cry a river
